intro: Euphrosinia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow or orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Euphrosinia has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
